question:
Who among the following have been given rights to take part in the proceedings of both the houses of the parliament without even being member?
  1. Attorney General of India
  2. Comptroller and Auditor General of India
  3. Solicitor General of India
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Though Attorney General is not a member of the Cabinet he has the right to speak in both the Houses of Parliament and any committee thereof, but he has no right to vote. In the performance of his official duties the Attorney General shall have a right of audience in all the courts in the territory of India.
